As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex issues and suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some issues and feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
The `tsc -d filename.ts` is great:
* It lets me create a declaration file that I can use for quicker complication of other modules (I can use reference comments to refer to it). 
* I can comment it and share it with colleagues as a quick reference for what a complex class or module does, while not forcing them to read the implementation.

But! After I do it, if I change anything, I have not way to check that the declaration file still matches my implementation. 

How about a new comment tag that allows me to check a declaration is still matched by an implementation? 
```
/// <declaration path='path-to-declaration-file1.d.ts' />
```
and 
```
/// <implementation path='path-to-implementation-file1.ts' />
/// <implementation path='path-to-implementation-file2.ts' />
```

Thoughts?
